0.title: Wildfire in eastern Spain is out of control: Authorities
0.article_body: Authorities in eastern Spain on Friday said a wildfire is out of control and 35 aircraft are fighting the blaze which has entered its fifth day. The fire has already scorched 19,000 hectares of forest land. Despite a bout of rainfall on Thursday, strong winds made the fire "very aggressive", the Valencia regional government said.

1.title: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla's term extended till Aug 22, 2023
1.article_body: The central government on Friday extended for the third time the service tenure of Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla for another year, up to August 22, 2023, according to a Personnel Ministry order. Bhalla, a 1984-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer of the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, assumed the office on August 23, 2019.

2.title: Kerala is not Russia under Stalin: Cong's Satheesan to CM Vijayan
2.article_body: Kerala's Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state police's move to banish Farzeen Majeed, a Youth Congress worker, from Kannur district under the Kerala Anti-social Activities (Prevention) Act. "CM Pinarayi Vijayan should bear in mind that this is not Russia under Stalin...Of the 19 cases against [Majeed]...12 are related to...violating the Covid-19 protocol," he said.

3.title: WHO recommends 2 monoclonal antibody treatments for Ebola
3.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended two existing treatments for the Ebola virus, saying they significantly reduce the number of deaths. The WHO said monoclonal antibodies Ebanga (mAb114) and Inmazeb (REGN-EB3) have "revolutionised" the treatment for the disease. The treatments are appropriate for pregnant and breastfeeding persons, old people, children and newborns, the WHO said.

4.title: H'yana appoints retired HC judge to probe killing of DSP in Nuh
4.article_body: The Haryana government on Thursday appointed a single-member inquiry commission to investigate the killing of DSP Surender Singh who was allegedly mowed down by a dumper truck during a raid against illegal mining in Nuh. The commission consists of retired Punjab and Haryana HC judge LN Mittal. The commission has been asked to submit its report within a month.

5.title: No reward bigger than this: Kartik as street vendor praises 'Bhool...'
5.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing him interacting with a young street vendor. In the video, the boy could be seen telling Kartik how much he loved 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He also did the signature step of the film before asking the actor for a selfie. "No reward bigger than this," Kartik captioned the video.

6.title: We wanted a podium finish at CWG after a bad hockey WC campaign: Salima Tete
6.article_body: Indian women's hockey team midfielder Salima Tete revealed that a podium finish was the only target that her side had at recently concluded CWG 2022 after a "bad" campaign at hockey World Cup. "Kuch na kuch karna hi hai (needed to do something)," she added. India won a bronze medal after beating New Zealand 2-1 in penalty shootout in Birmingham.

7.title: Trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged: Supreme Court
7.article_body: The Supreme Court said the trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged, as delays lead to problems in witness statements. The court made the observations as it granted bail to a man who is accused of helping the murderers of the Mayor of Chittor, Andhra Pradesh escape. The man was in jail for seven years but witnesses weren't examined.

8.title: Indian para javelin thrower Sumit Antil breaks his own world record
8.article_body: India's 24-year-old javelin thrower Sumit Antil on Friday broke his own world record at Indian Open National Para Athletics Championships 2022. Sumit set the new world record in F64 category with a best throw of 68.62 metres. Antil had set the previous world record (68.55 metres) at Tokyo Paralympics. He had broken world record thrice to win gold at Paralympics.

9.title: Manoj Tiwari calls for money laundering probe against Delhi Dy CM
9.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has called for a money laundering probe against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who the CBI raided over alleged irregularities in the Delhi excise policy introduced last year. Tiwari said probe agencies should inquire whether the AAP has converted black money in Delhi and other states. The MP demanded that Sisodia should resign over the allegations.

10.title: You have same rights as me: Bangladesh PM to Hindus on Janmashtami
10.article_body: Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said Hindu people in the country have the same rights as she has. Hasina was interacting with Hindu community leaders on the occasion of Janmashtami when she made the remarks. "Please don’t undermine yourselves (Hindus). You were born in this country, you are the citizens of this country,” she said.

11.title: Hope Dobaaraa goes for Oscars: Agnihotri on Kashyap's remark on Kashmir Files
11.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri said in an interview that he hopes people go and watch Anurag Kashyap's 'Dobaaraa', and make it more successful than 'The Kashmir Files'. "Hope it (Dobaaraa) goes for the Oscars," he added. Agnihotri was reacting to Kashyap's recent remark wherein he said he hopes the former's 'The Kashmir Files' is not India's official entry for Oscars.

12.title: Lab report shared by TDP on Andhra MP's 'nude' clip not original: CID
12.article_body: Karnataka CID has refuted Telugu Desam Party's claim that a US lab has certified that Andhra Pradesh MP Gorantla Madhav's alleged nude video was genuine. CID ADG Sunil Kumar said the certificate shared by TDP leaders wasn't original. Kumar claimed a lab official said it's suspected that the video, purportedly showing a nude Madhav attending a video call, was morphed.

13.title: 10 students critically injured as lightning strikes Odisha school
13.article_body: At least 10 students of a primary school in Odisha's Deogarh district were critically injured after they were struck by lightning on Friday afternoon. Officials said 17 students were present in class when the incident took place. As per reports, the impact of the lightning left a hole in the roof, while the floor of the classroom cracked.

14.title: Police stop PDP rally against voting rights for J&K 'non-locals'
14.article_body: Leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) were stopped by the police from protesting against electoral changes in Jammu and Kashmir allowing "non-locals" to vote. "Outsiders living temporarily...are being given voting rights, which is an attack on our identity and rights," said a PDP leader. The party was trying to take out a rally from Residency Road to Lal Chowk.

15.title: 14 including 5 children killed in rocket attack in northern Syria
15.article_body: At least 14 people were killed and 30 others were injured in a rocket attack on a market in northern Syria's Al-Bab on Friday, emergency responders working in the rebel-held areas informed. Five of those who lost their lives were children, rescue group White Helmets said. Al-Bab falls within the areas of Syria controlled by Turkish-backed armed opposition groups.

16.title: 11 civilians stranded on island formed in stream rescued in Himachal
16.article_body: The Army, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel and Himachal Pradesh Police's Quick Response Team on Friday rescued 11 civilians, who were stranded on an island formed in the middle of the fast-flowing Ghumarnu stream in Kangra. Earlier, the Kangra District Emergency Operations Centre had reported that the civilians were stuck due to a sudden increase in water levels.

17.title: Bee attacks Ishan Kishan during National Anthem, his reaction goes viral
17.article_body: A video went viral showing Ishan Kishan being attacked by a bee during National Anthem ahead of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. In the video, Ishan can be seen stunned after the bee attacks him. He can then be seen ducking before it flies away. "Similar things used to happen to me during prayer in school days," a fan tweeted.

18.title: Indian origin scientist joins NASA's Artemis I mission to the moon
18.article_body: Amit Pandey, who hails from Uttarakhand, is all set to join NASA's new moon programme Artemis I as a senior scientist. "NASA is currently undertaking a long-term lunar programme to enable astronauts to live and conduct research on the moon," Pandey, who works at Lockheed Martin, NASA's contractor for this mission, said in an interview with ETV Bharat.

19.title: Reuse, recycle water to become 'Aatmanirbhar': Shekhawat
19.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Friday said there is a need to reuse and recycle water in order to become "Aatmanirbhar" or self-sufficient in its supply. Speaking at the 'Har Ghar Jal Utsav' programme, Shekhawat also called for harvesting rainwater. 'Har Ghar Jal' programme will touch the lives of common people in the country, Shekhawat added.

20.title: 8 Kuki Tribal Union militants surrender in Assam's Haflong
20.article_body: At least eight militants of the Kuki Tribal Union (KTU) surrendered before security forces in Assam's Haflong on Friday, an official said. The group is mainly active in Kuki-dominated areas of Nagaland and Manipur, Dima Hasao and Karbi Anglong in Assam. It took us three months to convince them to surrender after their activities came to light, the official added.

21.title: Had night terrors after facing 'witch trial': Teacher forced to resign over bikini pics
21.article_body: The St Xavier's University, Kolkata professor, who was allegedly forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram, recounted her meeting with the Vice-Chancellor before she stepped down. She said it was a "witch trial" where she was "slut-shamed". "For many days after this episode, I was nauseous, unable to eat properly, visited by night terrors," she said.

22.title: Ambedkar's statue found damaged in UP's Sitapur
22.article_body: A statue of social reformer BR Ambedkar was found damaged in the Rikhipurwa village of UP's Sitapur district. The police have lodged a case against the unidentified suspects who had absconded after vandalising the statue in the early hours of Friday, police said. Notably, the district officials have assured the locals of their support in replacing the damaged statue.

23.title: Fire in sugar refinery kills 2 workers, injures 9 in Andhra Pradesh
23.article_body: Two workers were killed and nine others were injured in a fire that broke out at a sugar refinery near Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada on Friday afternoon. Police said that preliminary investigation revealed that an electrical short circuit might have triggered the fire at the conveyor belt in the unit. The injured persons were being treated in different hospitals, police added.

24.title: Bhagat enters singles, doubles finals at Thailand Para Badminton International
24.article_body: Indian shuttler Pramod Bhagat entered the finals of both men's singles and doubles at Thailand Para Badminton International 2022 tournament in Pattaya. Pramod defeated compatriot Kumar Nitesh 21-12, 21-18 in the men's singles. Bhagat along with his partner Sukant Kadam beat the Indian pair of Mohammad Arwaz Ansari and Deep Ranjan Bisoyee 21-10, 14-21, 21-14 in the men's doubles.

25.title: 14 fraud cases detected during Hisar's Agnipath recruitment drive
25.article_body: During the Agniveer recruitment rally in Haryana's Hisar, 14 aspirants were found to have allegedly used fake documents. "These cases are being caught due to strict vigilance and transparency in the recruitment process," said an official statement. The candidates allegedly used fake or tampered admit cards. The drive, under the Agnipath scheme, started on August 12.

26.title: Foreign engagement will be in line with Sharia: Taliban leader
26.article_body: Taliban's supreme spiritual leader Haibatullah Akhundzada on Thursday said that Afghanistan under Taliban will engage with the international community in accordance with Sharia law, media reports citing Afghanistan's information ministry said. "If Sharia doesn't allow it, we will not deal with any other country," he added. No country has formally recognised Taliban's rule in Afghanistan yet.

27.title: Not one asteroid but asteroid bombardment killed dinosaurs on Earth: Study
27.article_body: Not one asteroid but an asteroid bombardment on Earth might have killed dinosaurs, a new study has found. Previously, it was believed that a 10-kilometre-wide Chicxulub asteroid that struck Earth killed dinosaurs. But researchers have discovered an 8-kilometre-wide asteroid impact crater underneath North Atlantic Ocean, estimated to be 66 million years old, around the time of dinosaur extinction.

28.title: Ranbir Kapoor jokes about pregnant Alia Bhatt's weight in live video, fans react
28.article_body: During a live interaction on Thursday to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', Ranbir Kapoor joked about his pregnant wife, actress Alia Bhatt's weight gain. "Well, I can see somebody has phailoed (spread out)," he said while adding it's a joke. While some fans called it "distasteful", another fan wrote, "That was a disgusting joke to say to a pregnant woman."

29.title: You are affecting thousands of families: Vijay on 'Boycott Laal...' trend
29.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, reacting to the social media trend demanding a boycott of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said it doesn't only affect Aamir Khan but several others who are associated with the making of the film. "When Aamir sir makes a Laal Singh Chaddha...there are 2000-3000 families that are being provided for," he said, adding, "Please realise you're not affecting Aamir...alone but...economy."

30.title: 20-year-old Manisha Kalyan becomes 1st Indian to play in UEFA Women's Champions League
30.article_body: Forward Manisha Kalyan has become the first Indian footballer to play in the UEFA Women's Champions League. The 20-year-old achieved the feat by making her debut for Cypriot club Apollon Ladies against SFK Riga in the European club competition. Manisha came on as a substitute after 60 minutes in the match. Apollon Ladies FC won the match 3-0.

31.title: England's Barmy Army trolled for '1,000 days' tweet on Virat Kohli's century drought
31.article_body: England's Barmy Army today tweeted, "1,000 days," seemingly in reference to Virat Kohli not having scored an international hundred for 1,000 days. Indian fans trolled Barmy Army, with one writing, "3,532 days since England last won any format series against India in India." Another wrote, "Jason Roy + Bairstow + Buttler + Stokes = 59 international centuries...Kohli = 70 centuries."

32.title: China sentences Chinese-Canadian tycoon Xiao to 13 yrs in jail, fines his firm ₹64,500 cr
32.article_body: A Shanghai court has sentenced Chinese-Canadian billionaire Xiao Jianhua to 13 years in jail and fined his Tomorrow Holdings conglomerate 55.03 billion yuan (over ₹64,500 crore). Xiao and Tomorrow Holdings were charged with illegally siphoning away public deposits, betraying the use of entrusted property, and the illegal use of funds and bribery. Xiao hasn't been seen in public since 2017.

33.title: Geomagnetic storm creates aurora borealis in parts of US
33.article_body: As the sun is in its solar maxima, it has been erupting frequently and causing solar storms. One such geomagnetic storm that occurred on Thursday created a colourful aurora borealis that appeared in parts of the US. An aurora occurs when solar particles from the storm collide with the Earth's atmosphere. The next aurora will reportedly occur on September 23.

34.title: Nitish as Oppn's PM candidate an option if other parties want: JD(U) chief
34.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar as the Opposition's prime ministerial candidate is an option "if other parties want so", Janata Dal (United) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh said on Friday. "Nitish Kumar will work on bringing all other parties fighting the BJP on one platform to pose a united challenge to its rule," Singh added.

35.title: Centre scared as Kejriwal an alternative to PM Modi: Raghav Chadha
35.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said the Centre has "unleashed agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation" to "finish" party chief Arvind Kejriwal. Chadha said the BJP is "scared" of Kejriwal as he has emerged as an "alternative to PM Narendra Modi". On Friday, the agency raided Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence over alleged irregularities in Delhi's excise policy.

36.title: PETA writes to Indian Matchmaking's Sima after complaints about use of animals on show
36.article_body: PETA India wrote a letter to Sima Taparia and urged her to avoid using elephants and horses for future seasons of 'Indian Matchmaking' after receiving several complaints. It said animals are "not a good match" for wedding festivities because of the loud music, crowds and firecrackers. The letter elaborated on the atrocities animals often face when used for wedding processions.

37.title: Kejriwal govt looted Delhiites in name of liquor: BJP's Harsh Vardhan
37.article_body: Calling it the "most corrupt" government, BJP leader Harsh Vardhan accused Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP of looting people in the name of liquor in Delhi. "The corrupt, dishonest and liar Kejriwal government has no right to stay in governance," he said. "Kejriwal...has pushed the women and youth of the national capital to intoxication for his own selfish deeds," he added.

38.title: Fed up with her demand to get married, journalist kills lover in Maha; arrested
38.article_body: A 35-year-old journalist was arrested in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for allegedly killing a 24-year-old married woman with whom he was in a relationship and hacking her body into pieces. The woman had left her family and was living in a rented house. According to the police, the accused killed her as he was fed up with her demand to get married.

39.title: Bengaluru couple, their 9-year-old son found dead in apartment
39.article_body: A couple and their nine-year-old son were found dead in their apartment in Bengaluru on Thursday. The incident came to light when the family's relatives tried to contact them, but received no response, police said. Police suspect the man killed his wife and son first and later took his own life. The deceased's bodies have been sent for postmortem.

40.title: Student's suicide bid leads to fire at Hyd college; principal injured
40.article_body: A student leader threatened to set himself ablaze after pouring petrol on himself and the principal of Hyderabad's Narayana college on Friday. This resulted in an accidental fire which injured him, the principal and another college employee. The leader was arguing with the principal over the non-issuance of Transfer Certificate of a student reportedly due to unpaid fee worth ₹16,000.

41.title: Mangaluru civic body removes banner with pictures of Savarkar, Godse
41.article_body: A banner extending greetings on the occasion of the Janmashtami festival in Mangaluru's Surathkal area stirred controversy as it had pictures of Hindutva icon VD Savarkar and Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse. The banner, which was installed by a local Hindu Mahasabha leader Rajesh Pavitran, was later removed by the Mangaluru City Corporation after a complaint was received.

42.title: Open to feedback from citizens, activists: New PCMC chief
42.article_body: IIT Guwahati alumnus Shekhar Singh, who has taken charge as the new Commissioner of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), said he will be open to feedback and suggestions from citizens and activists. Singh has earlier served as District Collector of Satara and Gadchiroli. "My focus will be on major infrastructural projects, education and health," he said.

43.title: Delhi Dy CM listed as Number 1 among 15 accused in CBI's excise scam FIR
43.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has named 15 accused, including Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy. The agency raided at least 21 locations on Friday, including Sisodia's residence. "It is very unfortunate that those who do good work in our country are harassed like this," Sisodia tweeted.

44.title: Noida Police attach illegal assets worth ₹5.5 cr of 2 gangsters
44.article_body: Police in Gautam Buddha Nagar have attached "illegally-acquired" assets of two gangsters worth around ₹5.50 crore, officials said on Friday. The attached properties include one plot in Meerut, two in Noida and one four-wheeler and one two-wheeler. The alleged gangsters were identified as Sanjay Goyal and Sudesh Kumar.

45.title: Bhaichung Bhutia files nomination for AIFF President's post
45.article_body: Former Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia has filed his nomination for President's post in the upcoming AIFF elections. "In the wake of the Supreme Court decision to allow players I hope players can have a chance to serve Indian football. We want to show we can be good not only as players but also as administrators," Bhutia said.

46.title: KKR CEO's conversation with Irfan after appointment of Pandit as head coach goes viral
46.article_body: KKR CEO Venky Mysore's conversation with Irfan Pathan on Twitter after appointment of Chandrakant Pandit as head coach went viral. Responding to Irfan's old tweet wherein he suggested that Pandit should get a good IPL contract, Venky wrote, "We were listening to you Irfan bhai." Irfan replied, "Haha...Venky bhai...Wishing you and Chandu bhai all the luck...Sending you my bank details."

47.title: Which 13 states have been barred from buying, selling electricity on power exchanges?
47.article_body: A total of 13 states/UTs have been barred from buying or selling electricity from spot market for not clearing pending payments of ₹5,085 crore to power generators. They are Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Madhya Pradesh, Manipur, Mizoram, Jharkhand, Bihar, J&K, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Chhattisgarh. Telangana was listed as the highest defaulter with dues worth ₹1,381 crore.

48.title: Citigroup fined $15 million by UK's financial regulator for market abuse rule failings
48.article_body: New York-headquartered Citigroup has been fined $15 million by the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for failing to adequately monitor and report suspicious activity in financial markets for years. Citigroup's London-based trading arm didn't "properly" implement Market Abuse Regulation (MAR) trade surveillance requirements from when they were introduced in 2016 until early 2018, the FCA said.

49.title: We want to become India's electronic hub: T'gana Minister KTR
49.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday said the state wants to become India's electronic hub. "We are also a major player in Information Technology, hosting Microsoft's largest office outside of the US," KTR said. "The largest US FDA approved units outside of America are in Telangana which makes the state India's pharmaceutical hub," KTR further said.

50.title: Bihar CM's helicopter makes emergency landing in Gaya due to rain
50.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's helicopter on Friday made an emergency landing in Gaya due to bad weather conditions. The JD(U) chief had gone on an aerial survey of drought-hit districts including Gaya and Aurangabad on Friday morning. "The [helicopter] encountered en-route cloud on return as it was raining in Patna. We diverted it to Gaya," an airport official said.

51.title: Anurag would start 'Dobaaraa' shoot by hugging people: Vidusshi
51.article_body: Actress Vidusshi Mehra has said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, with whom she worked in the film 'Dobaaraa', would start the shooting by hugging people. She added that at the film's premiere, Anurag hugged each member of the cast and crew, including spot boys and technicians. "It...sets a benchmark of kindness and respect that sometimes goes missing in the industry," Vidusshi said.

52.title: I'd like to see India batting first: Maninder ahead of second ODI in Harare
52.article_body: Ahead of India-Zimbabwe second ODI, Maninder Singh said he'd like to see India batting first as playing in difficult conditions will be a test in Harare. India won the toss and opted to bowl first in their 10-wicket win in first ODI on Thursday. "We saw in...later overs when the surface dried up, it became good for batting," he added.

53.title: 4 arrested for running sex racket from Gurugram spa in mall
53.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a sex racket from a spa in Gurugram. The spa is located in Ocus Quantum Mall in Sector 51, officials said, adding that its owner Bhagat Singh and manager Yogesh were arrested. Preliminary investigation revealed the owner pushed the women into prostitution and charged ₹2,000 per customer.

54.title: Assistant Engineer arrested while taking bribe of ₹29,000 in T'gana
54.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested an Assistant Engineer of Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (TSSPDCL) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹29,000 from a private contractor, an official statement said. The accused, Baisu Govinda Raju, allegedly demanded the bribe from the contractor for preparing and forwarding the bills pertaining to the works executed by him.

55.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore seized in Thane, 2 arrested
55.article_body: Two people were arrested and 0.750-gm ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore was seized from them in Thane's Dombivli, police said on Friday. They were intercepted after police laid a trap near a hotel on Wednesday following a tip-off, an official said. They've been charged under Wild Life (Protection) Act. Sale or possession of ambergris is prohibited in India.

56.title: Men impersonating Mumbai policemen cheat Delhi senior citizen of ₹18 lakh
56.article_body: A senior citizen in Delhi's Dwarka was allegedly cheated of ₹18 lakh by men claiming to be Mumbai Police officers. The victim claimed the accused told him to pay the money on the grounds that a woman, who had earlier made an obscene call to him, had died by suicide. He approached cyber police after realising he was being defrauded.

57.title: Jimmy Fallon & Demi Lovato dance to 'Kala Chashma', Sidharth reacts
57.article_body: 'The Tonight Show' host Jimmy Fallon and singer Demi Lovato danced to 'Kala Chashma', a video of which was shared by the singer on her Instagram handle. Sidharth Malhotra, who featured in the song with Katrina Kaif, reacted to the video on Twitter, writing, "Happy to see @jimmyfallon & @ddlovato grooving on #KalaChashma. Thank you for the love."

58.title: Auto driver arrested for killing sex worker for money in Bengaluru
58.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly killing a female sex worker near Madiwala Lake in Bengaluru last week. The auto driver, Imran (28), killed the victim, Suraya (38), and robbed her of cash and other valuables after having sex with her, police said. Notably, Suraya had hired Imran's autorickshaw for three consecutive nights starting from August 8, police added.

59.title: Woman arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla with 1.25 kg ganja
59.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla area for allegedly peddling drugs, police informed on Friday. The accused, Sunita, was found in possession of 1.25 kg of ganja. Police said that she was seen making suspicious movements in Aruna Nagar on Wednesday. She was chased down by police after a brief pursuit, a police official informed.

60.title: UN peacekeeping mission pulls out of major city in Congo
60.article_body: The UN peacekeeping mission in Congo has withdrawn its personnel out of Butembo city following recent violent protests against the mission's alleged failure to protect civilians, UN and Congolese officials said on Thursday. The mission's spokeswoman, however, said "the mission has proceeded to a temporary redeployment of its personnel outside Butembo". She did not specify when they might return.

61.title: Gandhiji's statue at temple in US vandalised twice in 2 weeks, police share pic
61.article_body: A Mahatma Gandhi statue at a temple in New York's Queens was destroyed by a sledgehammer on Tuesday, in the second attack on it in two weeks. The statue outside the Shri Tulsi Mandir was reportedly smashed to pieces, defaced with obscenities and toppled over. Police shared the statue's pictures saying both incidents are being investigated as possible hate crimes.

62.title: BJP MLA Raja Singh tries to burn Munawar Faruqui's set in Hyd; stopped
62.article_body: Goshamahal BJP MLA Raja Singh, who was reportedly on his way to burn down the set at Shilpakala Vedika where standup comedian Munawar Faruqui is slated to perform on Saturday, was taken into preventive custody on Friday. Singh also told the media that his supporters have bought tickets to Faruqui's show and will try their best to stop the programme.

63.title: Unseeded Keys beats world no. 1 Swiatek to reach Cincinnati Open quarters
63.article_body: Unseeded Madison Keys defeated world number one Iga Swiatek 6-3, 6-4 to enter the quarter-final at Cincinnati Open on Thursday. "It feels great...I think I am playing some pretty good tennis," said Keys. It was Keys' first win in six matches against the top seed. The 2019 Cincinnati Open champion will face Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina in the quarter-final.

64.title: Our presence guarantees no 'Chernobyl scenario' in Zaporizhzhia: Russia
64.article_body: Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Friday said that the presence of Russian forces at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant guarantees that the plant does not witness a "Chernobyl scenario". On Thursday, the ministry had termed the UN proposal to demilitarise the area around the plant as "unacceptable". The plant has come under shelling several times in recent weeks.

65.title: 6 held after 83-year-old B'luru woman killed, robbed of ₹2 lakh cash
65.article_body: Six men of Nepali origin have been arrested after an 83-year-old woman was robbed and killed at her home in Bengaluru, police said. Five men were directly involved in the crime. The sixth provided information about the woman. Jewellery, gold and ₹2.4 lakh in cash were stolen from the house. The culprits include men involved in multiple robberies in Bengaluru.

66.title: Chennai woman finds worm crawling in her food; eatery faces temporary ban
66.article_body: A woman, who ordered 'Chhola Puri' at 'Namma Vidya Vasantha Bhavan' restaurant at a mall in Chennai, allegedly found a worm crawling in her food. She filed a complaint with the food safety department, following which they conducted an inspection and imposed a temporary ban on the restaurant. A warning regarding food safety measures was issued to the restaurant owner.

67.title: 'Jungle raj' prevails in Uttar Pradesh: BSP chief Mayawati
67.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Friday criticised the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and alleged that "jungle raj" prevailed in the state. "Overall, lack of judicious use of law in Uttar Pradesh, fearlessness among criminal elements are proof of poor law and order," Mayawati tweeted. "There is extreme poverty and unemployment in all parts of UP," she added.

68.title: List shows states/UTs where women tend to have more sexual partners than men
68.article_body: Women on average have more sexual partners than men in 11 states and UTs, according to data by National Family Health Survey. These states and UTs are Rajasthan, Haryana, Chandigarh, Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Kerala, Lakshadweep, Puducherry and Tamil Nadu. The survey was conducted among 1.1 lakh women and 1 lakh men.

69.title: Pune Metro to finalise DPR for 82-km route by August end
69.article_body: Pune Metro rail will finalise by August-end the detailed project report (DPR) for the proposed 82.5-km route which is part of the Phase 2 works of the city's metro project. The report will be sent for approval from the state and central governments. Meanwhile, authorities are planning to make the 33-km stretch in Phase 1 operational by March next year.

70.title: Mumbai's suburban rail network to be blocked on Aug 21 for maintenance work
70.article_body: The Western Railway will enforce a 'jumbo block' of five hours on its suburban section on August 21 for maintenance work. The block will be implemented on the Down Fast line between Borivali and Goregaon and on the UP Slow line between Borivali and Kandivali stations from 10 am to 3 pm on Sunday.

71.title: BJP has chosen path of nation building: PM Modi
71.article_body: While addressing the 'Har Ghar Jal' event, PM Modi appreciated NDA's governance and said that it is easy to form a government, but his party has "chosen the path of building the nation...which takes hard work". He also criticised the Opposition and said, "People who do not care about the nation don't show any concern or interest towards...problems."

72.title: Unlikely he'll touch victim knowing she's Dalit: Court on harassment accused activist
72.article_body: The Kerala sessions court judge who had granted bail to writer-activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case had called Chandran "a reformist". Judge S Krishnakumar said Chandran was "fighting caste system" and that it was "highly unbelievable that he'll touch the body of the victim...knowing that she's a member of Scheduled Caste". Krishnakumar had called the victim's clothes 'provocative'.

73.title: Johar is a courageous man, he hired his biggest critic: Anurag
73.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap in an interview called Karan Johar a visionary and courageous man. "Today, the creative head of Dharmatic Somen Mishra was the biggest Karan Johar critic and what Karan did was hire him," he added. Anurag further said Johar is a misunderstood person. The duo worked together in the 2015 film 'Bombay Velvet'.

74.title: Putin should be banned from G20: UK PM candidate Sunak
74.article_body: Britain's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak has called on the G20 to ban Russian President Vladimir Putin from its meetings until "he stops his illegal war in Ukraine", his spokesman said on Friday. "Sitting round a table with him [Putin] isn't good enough when he is responsible for children being killed in their beds as they sleep," the spokesman added.

75.title: IRCTC shares gain 3% a day after floating tender for data monetisation
75.article_body: A day after the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) floated a tender to monetise its data assets to bolster revenue and increase profits, its shares closed 2.94% higher on the National Stock Exchange on Friday. The Indian Railways' ticketing arm plans to generate a revenue of ₹1,000 crore. IRCTC reported a 198% increase in its Q1 net profit.

76.title: It will be remembered for a 'very long' time: Mona on 'Laal Singh...'
76.article_body: Discussing the box office failure of actor Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Mona Singh, who played Aamir's mother, said, "The movie...will be remembered for a very long time." Mona added that Aamir praised her performance after the film's editing was finished. The movie drew criticism for showing her playing Aamir's mother at 40, considering the latter is 57.

77.title: 48% pothole complaints reported from Mumbai's Western suburbs: BMC data
77.article_body: Data from Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) showed nearly 48% of total pothole-related complaints have been raised from Mumbai's western suburbs this year. This comes after a couple lost their lives in a road accident on Western Express Highway (WEH). "The WEH along with the adjoining service road is infamous for potholes...it's not BMC's responsibility to maintain them," an official said.

78.title: 4 Cong workers held for vandalising Mahatma Gandhi's photo in Rahul's Wayanad office
78.article_body: At least four Congress workers, including two staff members at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Wayanad office in Kerala, were arrested on Friday for vandalising a picture of Mahatma Gandhi, Kalpetta Police said. Congress had earlier alleged that Mahatma Gandhi's photo was damaged during the vandalism of the office allegedly by Students' Federation of India (SFI) activists on June 24.

79.title: Wanted Bihar ex-MLA on the run for over 20 years held near India-Nepal border
79.article_body: Former Bihar MLA Ranjan Tiwary, who was on the run for over 20 years, was arrested in Raxaul near India-Nepal border, police said. Tiwary was wanted by Uttar Pradesh Police for opening fire on police personnel and carried bounty of ₹25,000 on his head. "He was handed over to...UP Police for further prosecution after completion of initial formalities," police added.

80.title: New excise policy introduced to benefit liquor mafia: Delhi BJP chief
80.article_body: Reacting to the CBI raids at Manish Sisodia's residence, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta claimed that AAP introduced the new excise policy to benefit the liquor mafia. "Their sole focus was on bringing a new excise policy. They waived off ₹144 crore and gave the contracts to blacklisted companies instead of using the money for COVID relief," said Gupta.

81.title: Over 300 licences issued as Delhi to switch to old excise policy
81.article_body: Over 300 licences for retail liquor stores and 40 for wholesale stores have been issued in the national capital as Delhi prepares to switch to the old excise policy. Delhi government has also registered around 125 brands. "It's an ongoing process...in the coming weeks more licences are likely to be issued and more brands to be registered," an official said.

82.title: Coach thought I won't wake up after having 10 pegs of hard liquor, I scored a ton: Kambli
82.article_body: Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli, in a recent interview, revealed that he once had 10 pegs of hard liquor in the midst of a Ranji Trophy match and he went on to score a hundred the next day. "Our coach Balvinder Singh Sandhu was worried whether I would wake up on time. I did and scored a hundred," he said.

83.title: Will create bigger rivalry: Hogg on IPL, PSL being held alongside in 2025
83.article_body: Discussing the announcement of the men's 2023-2027 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "There's something that I love about it in 2025. That's the PSL being forced to take place alongside...IPL." "This...[will] create a bigger rivalry between the...countries," added Hogg. "Fans are going to get behind their T20 competition to outdo their rivals," he stated.

84.title: Plea in Patna HC seeks removal of Nitish Kumar as Bihar CM
84.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation has been filed in Patna High Court seeking the removal of Nitish Kumar as the Chief Minister of Bihar after he formed the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar. The plea states that voters had given a mandate to NDA, not to the Grand Alliance government. Petitioner Dharamsheela Devi said Kumar's act has damaged the parliamentary democracy system.

85.title: CBI raid an attempt to stop revolutionary work by Delhi govt: AAP leader
85.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said the CBI raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence was an attempt to stop "revolutionary work" done by AAP government in education and health sector. He claimed that the raids weren't regarding the liquor case. "Otherwise, there should've been raids in Gujarat...where numerous people lost their lives after consumption of spurious liquor," Sanjay added.

86.title: Youth gets life term for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyderabad
86.article_body: A POCSO court in Hyderabad on Thursday sentenced a 19-year-old youth to life imprisonment for sexually assaulting a minor girl in 2019. The court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him. As per the complaint, the accused lured the minor girl and took her to Cheryala village, where he sexually assaulted her by making false promises.

87.title: Xi & Putin to attend G20 summit in Bali: Indonesian Prez Widodo
87.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend the G20 summit in Bali in November this year, Indonesian President Joko Widodo told Bloomberg News in an interview. This update comes amid West's heightened tensions with Russia and China over Ukraine and Taiwan. The trip would also be Xi's first visit outside China since January 2020.

88.title: CDPQ likely to buy Vodafone's residual stake in Indus Towers: Report
88.article_body: Canadian pension fund Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec (CDPQ) is likely to acquire Vodafone's residual stake in Indus Towers, according to a media report. The report mentioned that due diligence is expected to begin soon. Vodafone's 21% stake in Indus Towers is valued at around ₹11,270 crore, based on the latter's ₹53,669.67 crore market capitalisation on Thursday.

89.title: Important for us to tell the story: Diljit on his film on 1984 anti-Sikh riots
89.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has confirmed his next film 'Jogi', which is set in the time of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Diljit, who was born in 1984, said he has grown up hearing stories about the riots, adding that the subject is really important for him. "It's very important for us to tell the story of the incident to...people," Diljit said.

90.title: I'd marry Messi at 'any moment', jokes ex-Argentina player Gorosito
90.article_body: Former Argentina footballer Pipo Gorosito jokingly stated that he would marry Lionel Messi at "any moment". "I feel so much admiration. For me, he is the ideal...friend," added Gorosito. Talking about Messi not being nominated for the Ballon d'Or for the first time since 2005, Gorosito stated, "There are interests that play in the nominations. It is very difficult."

91.title: I can't say if I'll be selected or not: India pacer Chahar on T20 WC spot
91.article_body: Speaking about his chances of securing a spot in India's squad for T20 World Cup following his bowling performance in the team's 10-wicket win against Zimbabwe in first ODI, India pacer Deepak Chahar stated, "I can't say if I'll be selected or not." Chahar, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', posted bowling figures of 7-0-27-3 in Harare on Thursday.

92.title: Govt agencies are part of BJP's Mahagathbandhan: SP leader
92.article_body: SP leader Sunil Singh Yadav condemned the CBI crackdown on Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in excise policy case. He accused probe agencies of working at behest of the BJP. "All government agencies...have become a part of BJP 'Mahagathbandhan' now, but the government should not forget the consequences any dictator faces; this government will also face the same," Yadav said.

93.title: People will beat him with shoes: BJP leader on Saugata Roy's shoes remark
93.article_body: BJP's national Vice President Dilip Ghosh said people will beat senior Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy with shoes. Ghosh's comment came after Roy said "shoes will be made by peeling off skin of those who believe they can get away by maligning the party". "TMC leaders will be beaten up with shoes in various parts of state," Ghosh added.

94.title: Interfaith couple found dead in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, probe underway
94.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was found dead in her boyfriend's relative's house in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Thursday, police said, adding that the boy was allegedly lying unconscious close to her body and later died. According to police, both belonged to different communities and were in a relationship. The autopsy report revealed that they died after consuming poison, police added.

95.title: Rana, 7-year-old sniffer dog of Mumbai Police bomb squad, dies
95.article_body: Rana, a seven year-old dog serving with the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) of the Mumbai Police, died on Wednesday, an officer said. The Labrador, who was trained as a sniffer dog, was undergoing treatment due to stomach-related ailments. Rana was given the proper police guard of honour reserved for the death of police personnel, the official added.

96.title: Sensex falls 651.85 points, Nifty ends below 17,800
96.article_body: The benchmark indices closed in the red on Friday with Sensex falling 651.85 points to 59,646.15. Nifty was down 198 points at 17,758.50. IndusInd Bank, Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Finserv, Tata Motors and Hindalco Industries were among the major Nifty losers, while Adani Ports, L&T, Infosys, Eicher Motors and Bajaj Auto stocks gained. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices dropped 1% each.

97.title: Everyone in theatre screamed 'Jai Mahishmati': Ananya on watching Baahubali
97.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said she went to watch SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' a day before her exam, along with father and actor Chunky Panday. "Everyone in the theatre screamed 'Jai Mahishmati' before the film started. They were screaming and crying together," added Ananya. Actress Ramya Krishnan, who starred in the film, said she's still in awe of the movie.

98.title: NEP envisioned increase in youth's employability: Education Minister
98.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan claimed that the aim of National Education Policy is to increase youth's employability. "The benefits of this scheme will be seen in a few years and then it will become successful. NEP has envisioned the increase in employability of nation's youth by training students in schools and giving importance to Indian languages," Pradhan said.

99.title: Delhi Police busts fake call centre cheating job seekers
99.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday raided a fake call centre near Subhash Nagar metro station that would allegedly cheat people of thousands of rupees on the pretext of training them for data scientist jobs. After a fake technical test and interview, job seekers would be declared failed and a fee to "train" them for the role would be sought, police said.

100.title: Earthquake of 3.6 magnitude hits Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh
100.article_body: Mild tremors were felt in the Pithoragarh area of Uttarakhand on Friday after an earthquake of 3.6 magnitude on the Richter scale hit the region. According to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS), the earthquake occurred around 12:55 pm. Earlier during the day, another earthquake of magnitude 3.1 on the Richter scale occurred near Jammu and Kashmir's Hanley village.

101.title: Vijay Deverakonda criticised for putting his feet up on table in front of journalist, responds
101.article_body: During a media interaction, Vijay Deverakonda put up his feet on the table while speaking with a journalist. The journalist told Vijay he wasn't able to talk freely with him, following which Vijay made an attempt to comfort him. After this led to reports about his attitude problem, Vijay tweeted, "Anybody trying to grow in their field will...have...target on...back."

102.title: Mumbai Police book principal for being racist towards tribal students
102.article_body: Seven tribal students of a teachers' training institute at Fort, Mumbai have accused their principal, Urmila Paralikar, of being "racist" and "vulgar". The Azad Maidan Police have booked Paralikar under the SC-ST Act, 1989 and Section 509 of the IPC. The complainants alleged that Paralikar commented on the private parts of the female students and mocked their tribal accents.

103.title: Paraguay VP backtracks, says he won't resign after corruption claims
103.article_body: Paraguayan Vice President Hugo Velazquez said that he was withdrawing his resignation, backtracking on a vow he made last week shortly after the US sanctioned him for "significant corruption". Velazquez told reporters he'd initially offered to resign as he "assumed" there was a domestic investigation against him. Velazquez said there's no investigation against him in Paraguay or in the US.

104.title: BJP has 2 hands, CBI & ED: TMC MP Roy after CBI raids on Sisodia
104.article_body: Following CBI raids on Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence, TMC MP Saugata Roy said, "BJP has two hands, CBI and ED. They did the same in Bengal and Maharashtra." Similar raids were carried out on Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain also, he added. "This is a tactic to suppress...Opposition. Nothing has been found in the raids," he further said.

105.title: Cactus Venture Partners closes debut fund with ₹350 crore
105.article_body: Cactus Venture Partners (CVP) announced raising ₹350 crore in the initial close of its debut fund. The early-stage venture capital fund will now expect to raise ₹750 crore by December 2022, the company said. It also plans to primarily invest the amount in clean-tech, health-tech and B2B SaaS companies in India. General Partners have also committed 15% to the fund.

106.title: Girl sitting with male friend stripped & thrashed in UP; 5 arrested
106.article_body: A girl sitting at a secluded spot with a male friend of hers was allegedly stripped and beaten with a belt in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur by six persons. Five of the accused persons have been arrested after a video of the incident went viral online. The accused also reportedly abused the duo and thrashed the girl's friend.

107.title: Ola told to pay ₹95,000 to customer who was charged ₹800 despite incomplete trip in Hyd
107.article_body: Ola Cabs has been told to pay ₹88,000 in compensation and ₹7,000 in legal fees for a man charged ₹861 despite 'poor service' and an incomplete trip in Hyderabad. The customer Jabez Samuel alleged he found the cab he boarded in October 2021 'untidy'. He also alleged that the driver behaved rudely and dropped him off without completing the trip.

108.title: MP ASI seeks spiritual guru's 'guidance' to solve murder case; suspended
108.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur was suspended after he allegedly sought the guidance of a self-styled 'spiritual guru' to solve a 17-year-old girl's murder case. In a video that surfaced online, the 'spiritual guru' purportedly said he has called out a few names and the one name that he missed is a clue about the accused's identity.

109.title: GHMC to get 24 fabricated ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Hyd
109.article_body: Ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to procure 24 portable prefabricated fibre-reinforced plastic ponds for idol immersion in Hyderabad. It's also planning to create 22 temporary excavated ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols. This comes after the Supreme Court's order to not allow immersion of idols made of Plaster of Paris in Hussain Sagar.

110.title: Google Search working on updates to make clickbait content less visible
110.article_body: Google announced it is working on updates to improve its search results as "people don't find content helpful if it seems like it was designed to attract clicks rather than inform readers". The updates will ensure that poor-quality content does not rank high in Google's Search results, it said. Starting next week, updates will roll out for English users globally.

111.title: DIIs have sold shares worth ₹4,283 crore in August so far: NSE
111.article_body: Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have sold around ₹4,283 crore in Indian shares since the beginning of August, National Stock Exchange (NSE) showed. DIIs have also bought a net of more than ₹3.67 trillion between March 2021 and July 2022. DIIs have bought shares worth nearly ₹2.37 trillion so far this year, absorbing the foreign institutional investors' (FIIs) selling pressure.

112.title: Secunderabad man cheated of ₹40 lakh in cryptocurrency fraud
112.article_body: A resident of Secunderabad was allegedly cheated of ₹40 lakh on the pretext of investing in cryptocurrency by a fraudster he befriended on Facebook. The accused claimed to be a businessman dealing in cryptocurrency in Hong Kong. "On the pretext of making systematic investments to get good profits, the fraudster collected...password and login id...and duped him," Cyber crime officials said.

113.title: Declare lumpy skin disease in cows as pandemic: Raj CM to Centre
113.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday demanded that the central government should declare the lumpy skin disease in cows as pandemic and give assistance to the state to handle the situation. "The way cows succumb to this disease is painful and unimaginable," Gehlot said. Over 22,000 animals, mainly cows, have died due to the disease in Rajasthan.

114.title: 'Fitoor': Vicky Kaushal on the Katrina Kaif film which he 'hates'
114.article_body: Talking about the film starring his wife and actress Katrina Kaif which he "hates", during an appearance on 'Koffee with Karan 7' alongside actor Sidharth Malhotra, actor Vicky Kaushal named "Fitoor". Talking about the failure of 'Fitoor', Katrina had earlier said, "My priorities were...different at that point in time...If a person takes things for granted...the film will obviously suffer."

115.title: Top seed Medvedev enters 2nd Masters 1000 quarters of 2022 at Cincinnati Open
115.article_body: World number one and top seed Daniil Medvedev defeated Canadian Denis Shapovalov 7-5, 7-5 to reach his second ATP Masters 1000 quarter-final of the season at Cincinnati Open on Thursday. "In general, happy with my level," said Medvedev. The 26-year-old Russian will now face American Taylor Fritz, who beat sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev 6-7(4-7), 6-2, 7-5 in the round of 16.

116.title: Gold falls to 3-week low, heads for weekly drop amid strong dollar
116.article_body: Gold prices dropped to a three-week low on Friday in the international markets amid chances of more rate hikes by the US Federal Reserve and a stronger dollar. The prices were also heading for their first weekly decline in five weeks. On the Multi-Commodity Exchange, gold contracts were trading 0.3% lower at ₹51,451 per 10 gram.

117.title: Hate my 'Darlings' character to the core, will never revisit the film: Vijay
117.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who played the role of an abusive husband Hamza in his latest film 'Darlings', has said that he hates the character "to the core". He said that he is "done" watching the film, adding he is never going to revisit it. "It is a difficult experience watching yourself be this man you hate," Vijay further said.

118.title: IMD predicts intense rainfall over east-central India
118.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted intense rainfall during the next three-four days across east-central India due to development of a depression over north Bay of Bengal. The depression is likely to cross West Bengal and Odisha coast between Balasore & Sagar Island today evening. "We are expecting heavy rain over Odisha on August 19 and 20," said DG, IMD.

119.title: US to give 8 attack & utility helicopters to Czech Republic for free
119.article_body: The US will give Czech Republic eight Bell military helicopters for free, US embassy in Prague said. The move comes in response to Prague's "clear and unwavering stance" on Russia-Ukraine war, Czech Defence Minister said. "Not only have we gained the respect of our allies...[by] helping Ukraine, but we've also gained their support in modernising our army," Jana Cernochova added.

120.title: Late, but welcome: Congress on CBI raid at Delhi Dy CM Sisodia’s house
120.article_body: Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee head Anil Kumar hailed the CBI search at Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday, calling the raids "late, but welcome". "The Congress party has been continuously demanding this raid," Kumar said. "You haven't got a licence for corruption by putting forward your education and health model," he added.

121.title: Gandhi said alcohol destroys both body and soul: Gambhir after CBI raids
121.article_body: Following CBI raids at 21 locations in connection with the excise policy case, including the residence of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, cricketer-turned-BJP leader Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to say "Delhi deserves better". "Mahatma Gandhi had said alcohol destroys both body and soul," his tweet read. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had "welcomed" the CBI earlier today.

122.title: Salman's ex-girlfriend Somy calls him a 'woman beater', says 'he's a sadistic sick *#uk'
122.article_body: Former Bollywood actress Somy Ali has shared an old poster of Salman Khan-starrer 'Maine Pyar Kiya' on Instagram and wrote, "A women beater, and not just me, but many." "Stop worshipping him please. He's a sadistic sick *#uk. You have no idea," she added. In a post in March, Somy had claimed that 'Harvey Weinstein of Bollywood' will be exposed.

123.title: Kejriwal shares NYT story on Delhi schools amid raids on Delhi Education Minister
123.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal shared a picture of a New York Times (NYT) front page that featured a story on Delhi's schools, amid CBI raids on Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia. Calling Sisodia "the best education minister of independent India", Kejriwal said, "CBI is welcome. We will cooperate fully." He said the agency "won't find anything" in the raids.

124.title: Wanted to join Army, but couldn't due to my family situations: Rajnath
124.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday revealed that he'd also wanted to join the Army and gave Short Service Commission examination. However, he said that due to certain situations in his family, including his father's death, he was unable to do so. Moreover, he said, "If you give...Army uniform to a kid, his personality changes. There is...charisma in this uniform."

125.title: Case filed against B'luru college for holding I-Day event without permission
125.article_body: A case has been registered against Mount Carmel College (MCC) in Bengaluru for organising a cultural event on Independence Day without permission. According to an inquiry, the college management had forced the students to sell tickets to the event. As a result, nearly 8,000 people were on the street which led to inconvenience to the general public, police said.

126.title: He is not brain dead, injections caused swelling in brain nerves: Raju's manager
126.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's manager has denied reports that he is brain dead. "There is nothing like this. He is unconscious. There was swelling in his brain nerves," he stated. "With some medicines, he was unable to respond. Then some injections were given which caused swelling in some of his brain nerves. Doctors are treating it," the manager added.

127.title: 10 crore rural households connected to clean piped water facility: PM
127.article_body: Speaking at 'Har Ghar Jal Utsav' in Goa, PM Narendra Modi said that 10 crore rural households of India are now connected to the facility of clean water through pipes. "In the seven decades since the Independence...three crore rural households had piped water," PM added. Goa has become the first state to be certified with 'Har Ghar Jal', PM stated.

128.title: Pilots fall asleep while flying Ethiopian Airlines plane at 37,000 feet, miss landing
128.article_body: Two Ethiopian Airlines pilots fell asleep while flying a plane from Sudan to Ethiopia and missed their landing on Monday. The plane's autopilot system kept the plane cruising at 37,000 feet. When the plane overflew the runway where it was supposed to land, the autopilot disconnected. That triggered an alarm, which woke up the pilots, according to Aviation Herald.

129.title: Anurag Thakur is a 'goli maaro chhap' minister: AAP leader after CBI raids
129.article_body: After Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur's remarks following CBI raids at the residence of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh called him a "goli maaro chhap" minister. "It is unfortunate that Anurag Thakur is a minister of the country who had said goli maaro...I don't take his comments seriously," Sanjay Singh said.

130.title: TV actress Nupur quits industry, says 'my husband has freed me, I'm going to Himalayas'
130.article_body: TV actress Nupur Alankar has quit the industry, stating that she took 'sanyaas' in February. Adding that she's leaving Mumbai and moving to Himalayas, Nupur said her husband Alankar Srivastava has freed her to follow the spiritual path. "When I was a part of showbiz, I worried about popularity and success. Today, I am at peace," she said.

131.title: Not 1st case of corruption by AAP: Thakur as CBI raids Sisodia
131.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised AAP as the CBI conducted raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence and other locations in connection with the Delhi liquor policy case. "No matter how hard a corrupt person tries to prove himself innocent, he will still remain corrupt. This is not the first case of corruption by AAP," Thakur said.

132.title: Rajasthan govt to give smartphones to 1.35 crore women in the state
132.article_body: Rajasthan government has decided to give smartphones to 1.35 crore women in the state as part of the Chief Minister Digital Seva Yojana. As many as three major Indian telecom companies have shown interest, officials said on Friday. Women heads of 1.35 crore families under the Chiranjeevi Health Insurance Scheme will be given smartphones with internet connectivity for three years.

133.title: Misuse of investigative agencies help corrupt get away: Congress
133.article_body: The Congress on Friday said the "relentless misuse" of investigative agencies against political rivals erodes their credibility. "In the process, the corrupt get away hiding behind the 'misuse' argument and the honest end up paying the price," party spokesperson Pawan Khera tweeted. This comes after CBI raided residence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia over the Delhi excise policy case.

134.title: Thailand saw 3.78 million tourists from Jan to mid-Aug: Govt
134.article_body: Thailand saw 3.78 million tourist arrivals from January to August 17 this year, Taweesin Visanuyothin, a government spokesperson, said. The arrivals generated revenues of 176 billion baht ($4.93 billion), he added. Visanuyothin also said that Thailand will extend the duration of its visa-on-arrival, which applies to Indian, Chinese and Saudi Arabian nationals, from 15 days to 30 days from October.

135.title: 4-storey building collapses in Mumbai's Borivali West; video surfaces
135.article_body: A four-storey building collapsed in Saibaba Nagar of Borivali West in Mumbai on Friday, Fire brigade officials said. A video of the building collapsing has surfaced online. At least eight fire engines and fire brigade personnel rushed to the spot, BMC said. Earlier this month, a portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane city's Daighar area collapsed.

136.title: He wanted to 'protect' himself: Sivaramakrishnan on Kuldeep's 0/36
136.article_body: Discussing Kuldeep Yadav's spell in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, where he conceded 36 runs without picking a wicket, ex-India leg-spinner Laxman Sivaramakrishnan said Kuldeep wanted to "protect" himself. "MS Dhoni would advice Kuldeep...on what to bowl...But today, the situation was different," added Sivaramakrishnan. "Kuldeep was making a comeback...He wanted to play all...games," he stated.

137.title: Parts of Gurugram to get no water for 24 hrs on Aug 22, list of areas shared
137.article_body: Water supply will be affected in parts of Gurugram for 24 hours from August 22 to August 23 because of master water supply pipeline from the Basai water treatment plant being shut due to construction work. Supply will be affected in sectors 4, 5, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, 21, 22, Palam Vihar and Dayanand colony, a notice said.

138.title: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya applies for US Green Card: Reports
138.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who recently fled the country, has applied for a US Green Card, reports said. His lawyers have started the procedure to obtain the Green Card, stating Rajapaksa's wife Loma being a US citizen as the factor which makes him eligible for it, reports added. Rajapaksa in 2019 renounced his US citizenship to contest Presidential elections.

139.title: Mother, lover beat minor son, burn him with hot sieve in Gurugram
139.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly beating her 13-year-old son and burning his face and feet with a hot sieve after he saw them in an objectionable position in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. The woman's lover also apparently threatened to chop the boy's legs when the latter threatened to complain. The boy, however, managed to escape.

140.title: Traffic diversions to be in place today in Pune for Dahi Handi
140.article_body: The Pune City Traffic Police has announced that traffic diversions will be in place in parts of the city from 5 pm today as festivities for Dahi Handi are expected to attract large crowds. The traffic police said that the diversions will be in place until the 'handis' or earthen pots are broken and the roads are cleared for traffic.

141.title: Govt shares map, says 'IITs reaching students in every corner of India'
141.article_body: The Centre has shared a picture of the map of India, showing the presence of IITs in as many as 21 states and two union territories. "Indian Institute of Technology (IITs) reaching students in every corner of India," the Centre tweeted. It also stated that eight of the IITs were established in the last decade.

142.title: 15 prisoners get death sentence for killing inmate in Jharkhand
142.article_body: A court in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district has handed death sentence to 15 prisoners for killing a fellow inmate at the Ghaghidih Central Jail in 2019. Seven others have been sentenced to 10 years in jail. The killing occurred following a clash between two factions of prisoners over breaking a queue at the jail's telephone booth.

143.title: Be careful while signing official documents: Mamata to WB ministers
143.article_body: While addressing a meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday told all of the state ministers to be "very careful" while signing official documents, a senior official said. This comes after the arrests of former state minister Partha Chatterjee and TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in separate alleged scams. "You (ministers) should all maintain a simple life," Banerjee said.

144.title: Pune reports rise in swine flu cases; vaccines distributed to hospitals
144.article_body: Pune city has been witnessing a rise in swine flu cases with 435 positive cases and 20 deaths till August 16. Vaccine stock has been supplied to hospitals to ensure that high-risk patients don't face inconvenience, Health department officials said. As many as 3,785 samples were sent for testing this year and 435 patients tested positive, Pune Municipal Corporation added.

145.title: Arvind Kejriwal issues missed call number for 'Make India No. 1' mission
145.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Friday launched a missed called number as part of the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "I am issuing a number today, missed call number 9510001000. Those who want to join this mission, those who want to see India as...the most powerful nation...should join this mission," Kejriwal said.

146.title: Two wickets down, one to go: Mishra after CBI raids Sisodia's residence
146.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday morning, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said "two wickets had fallen and the third will soon". "I've been saying...Satyendar Jain, Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal will all go to jail for corruption," Mishra tweeted. Earlier in May, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested in an alleged money laundering case.

147.title: Pune woman leaves home to end life, police check hotels; locate, rescue her
147.article_body: The Pune city police located a woman who had allegedly left her house with an intention of ending her life. She was located after police checked several hotels and lodges in the city. The woman is a doctor and her husband had filed a missing complaint after she had left home. Reports said that she was reunited with her family.

148.title: J&K Waqf Board bans trustees from collecting donations at shrines
148.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Waqf Board has banned trustees from collecting donations at shrines and mosques, calling it an "unethical practice". The decision on the ban was taken following complaints "against some people receiving donations forcibly and through exploitative means", according to the Board. The Board said that such acts of "pilferage" are "severely limiting" its ability to perform charity.

149.title: India's CWG lawn bowls champs break down, say 'People said we were selected due to looks'
149.article_body: The members of India's women's fours lawn bowls team, that won historic gold at CWG 2022, broke down during an interview recalling the criticism they faced in the build up to the Games. Lovely Choubey stated people told them that they were selected due to their looks. "Criticism that we faced cannot be expressed in words," said Rupa Rani Tirkey.

150.title: 21-yr-old woman gets 3 men to gang-rape 11-yr-old friend, watches it in Mumbai
150.article_body: An 11-year-old girl was gang-raped by three men in Mumbai's Virar. The girl had gone for a walk with a 21-year-old female friend, whom she met at a mobile repair shop. The female friend took the victim to an isolated spot and called three of her male friends. The victim's friend then watched the sexual assault.

151.title: 3 arrested for rhino horn smuggling in Assam
151.article_body: Three people have been arrested by the forest officials in Assam for their involvement in the smuggling of rhino horns near Kaziranga National Park. "One of the accused was caught from the Baghmari area. After his confession, two others were also nabbed," said District Forest Officer. Park officials found the dehorned rhino on May 9.

152.title: Video of KL Rahul removing chewing gum before National Anthem goes viral, fans react
152.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain KL Rahul removing chewing gum from his mouth ahead of the National Anthem before the start of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. "Proud of you," a fan wrote. "He is truly a gentleman," wrote another. Earlier, Virat Kohli was criticised for chewing gum during National Anthem in 2017 and January 2022.

153.title: PM Modi extends greetings to citizens on Janmashtami
153.article_body: On the occasion of Janmashtami, PM Modi greeted citizens and wished for everyone's prosperity. "Hearty greetings to all the countrymen on the auspicious occasion of Janmashtami. May this festival of devotion and gaiety bring happiness, prosperity and good fortune to everyone's life. Long live Shri Krishna!" tweeted PM. President Droupadi Murmu also extended greetings on the auspicious day.

154.title: Eatery owner stabs customer after dispute over biryani bill in UP
154.article_body: An eatery owner allegedly stabbed a customer following a dispute over biryani bill in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun. According to police, the victim paid ₹50 to the owner for biryani but the latter denied having received the payment and demanded money again. This led to a brawl. The customer was hospitalised after getting stabbed multiple times, while the accused is absconding.

155.title: 2022 deadliest year on record for Mexican journalists: Report
155.article_body: Article 19, a human rights organisation, said in a report that 2022 has been the deadliest year on record for journalists in Mexico, with 18 murders. Nine of those deaths have showcased a potential link to the journalist's work, the organisation's regional director Leopoldo Maldonado said. Maldonado added, "2022 could be the worst year in a century for the press."

156.title: Domino's India parent stock gained 14% so far in Aug after Q1 results
156.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, parent company of Domino's Pizza India, fell over 3% on BSE at 11:50 am on Friday. However, it gained over 14% so far this month while witnessing an upward trend. The company reported a strong Q1 earnings with a 63% growth in consolidated profit at ₹112.6 crore and its consolidated revenue from operations was up by 40.5%.

157.title: Country's confidence and trust in BJP has grown: Rajnath Singh
157.article_body: Talking about BJP's pro-people ideology, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh claimed that country's confidence and trust in the party has grown. "The perception of the people about the BJP has changed. There has been a sense of trust and confidence across India towards the BJP. India's reputation has risen on the international level," said Singh.

158.title: Oil prices fall amid global economic slowdown concerns
158.article_body: After two days of gain, oil prices fell on Friday amid concerns about a global economic slowdown. Brent crude futures fell 36 cents to $96.23 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude was at $90.29 a barrel, falling 21 cents. US crude oil inventories declined as US exported 5 million barrels per day in the most recent week.

159.title: What is the wait time for US visa appointment in different Indian cities?
159.article_body: The US has listed that people applying for visitor visa in Delhi will have to wait 582 days for an appointment while the wait time for student visa is 471 days. The wait time for visitor visa in Mumbai is 580 days. The waiting period for visitor visa in Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai is 587, 510 and 513 days, respectively.

160.title: Windfall profit tax on diesel export hiked, domestic crude tax cut
160.article_body: The government on Thursday increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel to ₹7 per litre from ₹5 per litre, Finance Ministry notification showed. It also brought back a ₹2 a litre tax on the export of aviation turbine fuel. The tax on domestically produced crude oil has been slashed from ₹17,750 per tonne to ₹13,000 per tonne.

161.title: It's Raj's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister: BJP
161.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia on Thursday said it is the state's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister for the last three-and-a-half years. He alleged that Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, who also handles the home department, doesn't seem concerned about public safety. "For him, the security of his chair is bigger than people's security," Poonia added.

162.title: No competition from Karthik for a spot in T20Is: Chandu Borde on Pant
162.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Chandu Borde said he doesn't think there is "any competition" for Rishabh Pant from Dinesh Karthik for a spot in T20Is. "Pant is not just a finisher, he can play anywhere...He is an automatic choice," added Borde. Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan earlier selected Karthik over Pant while naming his lineup for T20 World Cup 2022.

163.title: Family said 'Didn't educate you for this': Anurag on decision to go into cinema
163.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, while talking about his decision to enter the cinema industry, said that his family was not supportive. "They were supportive of like, 'If you have decided, then go and try. But, we didn't educate you so much for this'. It was like, 'Let him try for 1-2 years...then he'll come back on his own'," he added.

164.title: Estonia hit by cyberattacks after removing Soviet-era monument
164.article_body: Estonia said it has repelled "the most extensive cyberattacks since 2007" shortly after removing a Soviet-era tank monument. Russian hacker group Killnet claimed responsibility for the attacks, saying it'd blocked access to over 200 state and private Estonian institutions. Estonia's government on Tuesday ordered the swift removal of all public Soviet memorials, citing Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

165.title: Every inning is like a 'war' for him: Kaif on Shikhar Dhawan's 81*
165.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said every inning is like a "war" for Shikhar Dhawan, who scored an unbeaten 81 in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, which India won by 10 wickets. "Dhawan...plays ODIs only...If he does badly, then he'll be out from here as well," added Kaif. "He did not have a good ODI tour of England," stated Kaif.

166.title: K'taka woman elopes with lover in Saudi; man kills self, poisons 3 kids
166.article_body: A man in Karnataka's Tumakuru died after he allegedly consumed poison after his wife eloped with her lover in Saudi Arabia, police said. He also poisoned their three children who are reportedly critical at a Bengaluru hospital. The wife allegedly made video calls to the man showing herself enjoying at different locations with her lover in Saudi, police added.

167.title: Bengal once centre of excellence, now seeing 'scams' in education: Pradhan
167.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Thursday said West Bengal, which was once known as a centre of culture and excellence, is now being maligned due to scams. "Influential leaders of ruling party...involved in scams have minted money and...deserving...aspirants are on roads for over 500 days. Such things shouldn't be tolerated as Bengal was known for education," Pradhan added.

168.title: IAS officer reacts to Bilkis rape convicts' release, says 'I sit in disbelief as a woman'
168.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing her family members were released, IAS officer Smita Sabharwal tweeted, "As a woman and civil servant I sit in disbelief, on reading the news on the #BilkisBanoCase." "We cannot snuff out her Right to breathe free without fear, again and call ourselves a free nation," she added.

169.title: Social media influencer Bobby Kataria to be arrested for liquor stunt on road
169.article_body: Social media influencer Bobby Kataria will be arrested by Uttarakhand Police for drinking alcohol and threatening the police while sitting on a chair in the middle of the road and stopping traffic in Dehradun. Police has obtained a non-bailable warrant against Kataria from the district court, SHO Rajendra Singh Rawat said. Multiple teams are being sent for his arrest.

170.title: Over 6,000 signatories demand to reverse Bilkis Bano case convicts' release
170.article_body: Over 6,000 citizens, including historians, activists, women, grassroots workers and others have urged the Supreme Court to reverse the release of 11 men convicted of rape and murder in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case. "The remission of sentences for convicted...will have a chilling effect on every rape victim who is told to 'trust the system'...'have faith'," the signatories said.

171.title: AIMIM will contest municipal polls in UP, says party's state chief
171.article_body: All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) will contest municipal elections across Uttar Pradesh, party's state unit chief Shaukat Ali Khan said on Thursday. "Soon we will announce candidates for Chairman, Panchayat Raj and other posts," he added. The party had fought the state election held earlier this year but failed to win any seat.

172.title: TV actress Kanishka Soni says she has married herself, posts pic with mangalsutra
172.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni has claimed that she has married herself while posting pictures of herself wearing a mangalsutra and sporting sindoor.
