347.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Mehmadpur for wearing a burqa while going to meet his girlfriend. Saif Ali, who got a job away from home, wanted to meet his girlfriend before moving out. So, he wore a burqa to hide his identity as he was known in the area. Ali has been booked for breach of peace.

348.title: Tulsi actives in hair oil reduce hair loss in 2 months: Kapiva
348.article_body: Kapiva shared that its Tulsi Anti Hairfall Oil contains Tulsi actives, 6 essential oils, and 19 Ayurvedic herbs heated over 24 hours to boost re-growth by 23%. Khus, methi, and hibiscus in the bottle allow continuous herbal infusion while the oil helps circulate blood to the scalp and contains natural DHT blockers that reduce hair loss, it added.

349.title: Sanju Samson picks Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
349.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson picked Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo, when asked to choose one during an interaction. Samson added that former Team India captain MS Dhoni is one of his "favourite" sporting personalities. Talking about his personal life, Samson shared that he enjoys eating chocolates, adding that "Bappu" is one of his nicknames, which many people don't know.

350.title: Last nail in coffin of democracy: Mufti on voting rights to outsiders in J&K
350.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the move where outsiders living in J&K will also be allowed to vote in UT now. "J&K has become laboratory for BJP. They conduct experiments here...implement...in other places…This is last nail in the coffin of electoral democracy," Mufti said. "BJP has only one objective, to form government everywhere by resorting to any method," she added.

351.title: AAP doing low level politics: Gambhir on Rohingyas accommodation in Delhi
351.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir reacted to AAP's claim that Centre was "secretly" trying to give residence to Rohingyas in Delhi and said, "Nobody can do politics as low as [AAP]." Why was the letter demanding better accommodation for Rohingyas written? Gambhir questioned AAP. "Our stand is very clear, HM had clarified...that we want to deport the Rohingyas," Gambhir added.

352.title: B'luru Police crack 89 cases, arrest 61 suspects; goods worth ₹2 cr seized
352.article_body: Bengaluru Police's North Division on Wednesday said that they have arrested 61 suspects in connection with peddling of drugs, extortion, house break-ins and chain snatching. In total, the police cracked about 89 cases and recovered materials worth ₹2 crore, Vinayak Patil, DCP (North), tweeted. Seized goods included 722 kg of red sandalwood and 51 two-wheelers among other items, Patil added.

353.title: Comparisons with Ranveer, Ranbir don't come to me organically: Vicky
353.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal said on 'Koffee With Karan 7' that he never gets into a comparison where he does not feel equal to them. "I used to watch their (Ranbir Kapoor and Ranveer Singh) films when I wasn't even in the industry...It (comparison) just doesn't come to me organically," he added. Vicky revealed he sometimes has fan moments with them.

354.title: Sanya Malhotra and Dhairya Karwa to star in a Dharma film: Reports
354.article_body: Sanya Malhotra and Dhaiya Karwa will share the screen space in an upcoming film, which will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions. As per reports, the makers wanted a new age on-screen pairing, which is why they have finalised Sanya and Dhairya as leads. Sanya and Dhairya have previously collaborated with Dharma Productions for 'Meenakshi Sundareshwar' and 'Gehraiyaan', respectively.

355.title: I played 'terribly': Rafael Nadal on loss against Borna Coric
355.article_body: Reacting to his 6-7(9-11), 6-4, 3-6 defeat against Croatia's Borna Coric in the second round of the Cincinnati Open, Rafael Nadal said, "I played terribly...It's obvious...I was not ready enough to win the match." "The last month and a half haven't been easy, because...of the abdominal tear," added Nadal. Nadal was playing his first match in over a month.

356.title: Flipkart to invest $500,000 in 6 early-stage startups
356.article_body: E-commerce platform Flipkart, has decided to invest up to $500,000 in six early-stage startups. The investment will be done by Flipkart's venture fund, Flipkart Ventures, which was set up in 2019. The startups were selected for an accelerator programme called Flipkart Leap Ahead, a 16-week mentorship training, during which startups will present ideas to potential investors and industry leaders.

357.title: Decided won't have baby until we are able enough: Bipasha on pregnancy
357.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said as a couple, she and her husband Karan Singh Grover were mature to know when they wanted to become parents. She said it was their mutual decision to not embrace parenthood until they felt "able enough". Bipasha said her mother was the first to know about her pregnancy. "It was my mother's dream," she added.

358.title: 13-yr-old 'kidnapped' boy found at Pune railway station; probe on
358.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have launched a probe into the alleged kidnapping of a 13-year-old boy who went missing from outside his school on Tuesday and was found at Pune railway station hours later. According to an FIR filed by his father, an unidentified person allegedly kidnapped the boy and covered his face with a handkerchief before taking him on a train.

359.title: 0 penalty charges on missed Mutual Fund SIPs: Jupiter
359.article_body: Banks charge you a penalty of up to ₹750 for missing your SIP autopay mandate due to low balance, shared Jupiter, a 100% digital banking app. On Jupiter, your Mutual Fund SIP is auto-skipped if balance is low to avoid penalty charges, while you earn up to 1.5% extra returns with 0-commission Direct Mutual Funds, over regular ones, it added.

360.title: Watch Shah Rukh Khan in 'Chak De! India' to know Pandit's style: Jaffer to KKR players
360.article_body: Reacting to Chandrakant Pandit being appointed KKR head coach, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he is happy for Pandit. He added, "To the KKR players unfamiliar with his coaching style, I'd suggest watching @iamsrk in 'Chak De! India' will help." Pandit is the first Indian to become KKR's head coach.

361.title: Delhi CM was kept in dark: Sisodia writes to Amit Shah on Rohingya row
361.article_body: Calling it a "conspiracy", Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday, criticising the Centre's move to "permanently settle" Rohingya refugees in Delhi. "Delhi Home Minister and the Chief Minister were kept in the dark," he alleged. "I came to know about this from newspapers," he wrote in the letter.

362.title: He approached me on Instagram, I answered after a long time: Morata's wife
362.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Alvaro Morata's wife Alice Campello said Alvaro asked many people to introduce him to her having seen her picture, but they had no common friends. "So, he wrote to me (on Instagram). I answered...after a long time," added Campello. "His friends and family...had never seen him like this...He kept telling...he wanted to marry me," she stated.

363.title: Players somehow come back to form against Pakistan: Danish Kaneria
363.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said the upcoming match between India and Pakistan at the Asia Cup might help Virat Kohli to come out of his poor form. "Players somehow come back to form while playing against [us]," he stated. "It's a big game for Virat...because this will decide what his future will be like," added Kaneria.

364.title: Nanny sexually assaults 5-yr-old girl in Gurugram school, booked
364.article_body: A five-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by a nanny at a private school in Gurugram, said police, adding that an FIR was registered against the woman and a probe has been initiated. She told us that the staff member touched her inappropriately and threatened to lock her in a room if she informed anyone, the victim's father said.

365.title: Woman poses as house help to rob 100 houses; arrested in Ghaziabad
365.article_body: Police arrested a woman named Poonam Shah in Ghaziabad for posing as a house help and robbing almost 100 houses in cities like Delhi, Jodhpur, Kolkata and Ghaziabad. Poonam, who faces 26 cases in Delhi NCR itself, used to steal gold ornaments from her employers. She has also built a house in Delhi using the proceeds of crime, police alleged.

366.title: Boat carrying AK-47 rifles, weapons found off Maha coast; high alert sounded in state
366.article_body: A high alert has been sounded in Maharashtra after an unmanned boat carrying weapons was found off a coast in Raigad. AK-47 rifles were among the weapons recovered by the police. Police stated that the vessel, a security boat, belonged to Oman security. Dismantled and sophisticated weapons were recovered which are of no use to anyone, added police.

367.title: IKEA Hyderabad fined ₹6,000 for charging customer ₹20 for carry bag
367.article_body: IKEA Hyderabad was asked to compensate a customer ₹6,000 for charging him ₹20 for a carry bag featuring IKEA's logo. Law student Kevin Sukirthy filed a complaint against IKEA under The Consumer Protection Act alleging that charging for the bag with IKEA's brand name amounts to unfair trade practice. IKEA has been given 45 days to comply with the order.

368.title: Mali accuses France of sending weapons to militants
368.article_body: Mali has accused France of supplying arms and intelligence to Islamist militants. In a letter to the UN Security Council, Mali's Foreign Minister Abdoulaye Diop said France has violated its airspace on multiple occasions and delivered arms to Islamist fighters in an attempt to destabilise his country. This comes as France pulled the last of its troops out of Mali.

369.title: When Sachin retired from Tests, we thought Rohit is the answer: Karthik
369.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma's Test career so far, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said Rohit was called the "big deal" after his consecutive hundreds in his first two Tests. "And the fact that Sachin [was] retiring from Tests...everybody thought this is it...but life and sport as it turns out is never exactly what you think it is," added Karthik.

370.title: Alvaro messaged on Instagram, I answered after a long time: Morata's wife
370.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Alvaro Morata's wife Alice Campello said Alvaro asked many people to introduce him to her having seen her picture, but they had no common friends. "So, he wrote to me (on Instagram). I answered...after a long time," added Campello. "His friends and family...had never seen him like this...He kept telling...he wanted to marry me," she stated.

371.title: Nitin Gadkari unveils double decker AC e-bus in Mumbai
371.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari unveiled electric double decker AC bus in Mumbai today. The bus is manufactured by a firm called Switch Mobility. "Giving dynamic boost to the sustainable transportation sector, such initiatives are cost-effective solutions and achieve PM Narendra Modi Ji's vision of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' by cutting down oil imports and promoting indigenous resource," Gadkari tweeted.

372.title: Only Leshi is always in cabinet, what does CM see in her?: JD(U) MLA; Nitish replies
372.article_body: Commenting on JD(U) MLA Bima Bharti's remark that only Leshi Singh is always chosen in Bihar cabinet, CM Nitish Kumar said he is shocked. "What does the CM see in her?" Bharti said. "We will talk to Bharti...try to convince her not to give such statements...If she doesn't understand...wants to go anywhere else, she can think about it," Nitish added.

373.title: 13-yr-old apprehended for raping 3-yr-old near Gurugram; survivor critical
373.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly kidnapping and raping a three-year-old girl in Nuh near Gurugram, police said. The incident took place on Tuesday when the victim followed her mother out of their house. "He picked her up and took her to a nearby field...raped her," police further said. The survivor is critical and is undergoing treatment, officials added.

374.title: Piyush Goyal inaugurates public systems lab for research at IIT Delhi
374.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal inaugurated a public systems lab (PSL) at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Delhi. The PSL will work closely with the UN World Food Programme (UNWFP) to identify projects around food systems and innovations. One of the proposed initiatives is to send experts to the Ministry of Food to help make food-based safety nets efficient.

375.title: Death toll from blast at mosque in Kabul rises to 21
375.article_body: The death toll from a blast at a mosque in Kabul during evening prayers on Wednesday has risen to 21, police said, adding another 33 people have been injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the blast so far. Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid condemned the explosion and vowed that the "perpetrators...will soon be brought to justice and will be punished".

376.title: My parents were very dramatic about my dating life: Janhvi Kapoor
376.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor revealed her parents were "very dramatic" about her dating life. "It's like 'when you like a guy, come to us and we'll get you married'," she added. Janhvi, who is the daughter of late actress Sridevi and producer Boney Kapoor, said, "They don't understand the concept of like chill." Janhvi recently featured in 'Good Luck Jerry'.

377.title: I demand Supreme Court's intervention: TRS MLC on Bilkis Bano case
377.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha criticised the Gujarat government after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano walked free in Gujarat. "To keep everyone’s trust in the law, it's necessary that this shameful decision should be withdrawn. I also demand the Supreme Court to intervene in this issue by taking suo moto cognisance into the case," she added.

378.title: Man molests woman at vegetable market in Santacruz; caught by Sena workers
378.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly molested by a man while buying vegetables at a market in Mumbai's Santacruz (West) on Monday. Some local Shiv Sena workers, who saw the man groping the woman, immediately caught him. The accused, Ankit Khalto (27), also reportedly flashed at the woman and passed obscene comments to her when she tried to resist.

379.title: Video showing Finland PM Sanna Marin partying leaked; criticised
379.article_body: The Prime Minister of Finland, Sanna Marin, has received criticism after a video of her partying was leaked online. "Finland is suffering from record high electricity prices, lack of health care & elderly care professionals and this is how our leader is spending her time!" a Twitter user wrote. "The most incompetent PM we ever had," another user tweeted.

380.title: Myanmar to import Russian fuel amid price rise: Myanmar military
380.article_body: Myanmar plans to import Russian fuel amid rising prices, a junta spokesperson said. Zaw Min Tun said authorities permitted to import petrol from Russia, favoured for its quality and low cost. In the past week, petrol stations have shut down in various parts of the country because of shortages. Myanmar is also considering joint oil exploration with Russia and China.

381.title: 19-yr-old security worker in Munich arrested over Nazi salute
381.article_body: Police in Munich arrested a 19-year-old for making a Hitler salute. Officers reportedly saw the individual making the Hitler salute towards a group of Israeli athletes on the sidelines of the European Athletics Championships. The straight-armed gesture, which was used by Nazis as a greeting, was outlawed soon after the end of the World War II in Germany and Austria.

382.title: Talks about ODI cricket dying are nonsense, I wish there was another format too: Rohit
382.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said the talks about ODI cricket dying are nonsense. He added, "For me...cricket is important, be it any format. I'd never say that ODIs are getting finished or T20Is are getting finished or Tests are nearing an end." Rohit stated, "I wish there was another format as well because for me...playing the game is most important."

383.title: 137 out of 140 candidates fail BCCI umpires' exam
383.article_body: The BCCI recently conducted a level-2 exam for umpires for eligibility to officiate in women's and junior matches that are categorised as Group D. Out of the 140 candidates who appeared for the exam, 137 failed. The cut-off for the exam was 90 marks out of 200 (100 for written test, 35 for viva and video, and 30 for physical).

384.title: Prepare for 5G launch: Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to telcos
384.article_body: Informing about the issuance of 5G spectrum allocation letters, Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday took to Twitter and wrote, "5G update: Spectrum assignment letter issued. Requesting TSPs to prepare for 5G launch." Department of Telecommunications received a payment of around ₹17,876 crore from Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, Adani Data Networks and Vodafone Idea for spectrum allocation.

385.title: Outsiders living in Jammu and Kashmir can also vote in UT now: Official
385.article_body: J&K Chief Electoral Officer Hirdesh Kumar has said after the abrogation of Article 370, many people who were not enlisted as voters are now eligible to vote and anyone who is living ordinarily can also get enlisted as a voter in J&K. He said that J&K will get around 25 lakh new voters including outsiders after revision of electoral rolls.

386.title: 2 suspected terrorists with al-Qaeda links arrested in West Bengal
386.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of West Bengal Police arrested two suspected terrorists having links with al-Qaeda in North 24 Parganas district on Wednesday night. The two, identified as Raqib Sarkar and Kazi Ahshanullah, were wanted in several cases. According to STF sources, both are members of al-Qaeda in Indian Sub-continent (AQIS), with Sarkar being the operation-in-charge of West Bengal.

387.title: US and Taiwan to hold trade talks after China holds military drills
387.article_body: The US government plans to hold talks with Taiwan on a wide-ranging trade agreement. US Trade Representative's office said that 'formal negotiations' were meant to grow trade and regulatory cooperation which would involve close official interaction. The announcement comes after China held military drills close to Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited the island nation.

388.title: Pandit scolds players a lot, will it work with int'l players?: Aakash
388.article_body: Discussing six-time Ranji Trophy-winning coach Chandrakant Pandit's appointment as KKR's new head coach, ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said, "Pandit scolds the players a lot...Will the same strategy work with the international players?" "In the IPL, you fondle more and scold less because you get a lot of established players," added Aakash. "The strictness works with small kids," he stated.

389.title: It was a long vacation for me: Deepak Chahar on India comeback after injury
389.article_body: Talking about his break from cricket since February this year due to injuries, India pacer Deepak Chahar, who's part of India's playing XI for the first ODI against Zimbabwe, said, "It was a long vacation for me. Now fully fit and back." Chahar had picked up a hamstring injury in the T20Is against West Indies at home earlier this year.

390.title: Govt spent ₹38 lakh on Trump's 36-hour visit to India in 2020, RTI reveals
390.article_body: The central government spent approximately ₹38 lakh during former US President Donald Trump’s 36-hour visit to India in 2020. Responding to an RTI, the External Affairs Ministry said these charges included accommodation, meals, logistics etc. Trump, his wife Melania, daughter Ivanka, son-in-law Jared Kushner and several top officials visited Ahmedabad, Agra, and Delhi on February 24-25, 2020.

391.title: Retired officer in Mumbai tries to return Amazon order, loses ₹1.04 lakh
391.article_body: A 67-year-old Mumbai-based retired sales tax officer was cheated of ₹1.04 lakh after he posted a return request on Amazon. As per the complainant, he received a call from a man claiming to be Amazon executive who sent him a link to fill in details like credit card number etc. On sending the details, money was deducted from his account.

392.title: Dr Reddy’s, Sun Pharma, others settle Zantac case, to pay $500,000
392.article_body: Several pharmaceutical companies, including Teva, Dr Reddy’s and Sun Pharmaceutical, have agreed to pay over $500,000 in all to US' Joseph Bayer. The plaintiff, Bayer, had alleged that he developed oesophagal cancer from taking the over-the-counter heartburn drug Zantac, which was originally marketed by GSK's forerunner and sold by several other companies. He has now agreed to drop his case.

393.title: Blackstone to sell 13.6% stake worth ₹4,000 cr in Sona BLW: Reports
393.article_body: American private equity firm Blackstone is likely to sell a 13.6% stake in Indian automotive component maker Sona BLW Precision Forgings (Sona Comstar) via a block deal on Thursday, according to reports. Blackstone, which currently holds a 34.12% stake in Sona BLW, is likely to raise ₹4,000 crore through the transaction. Shares of Sona BLW fell around 6% on Thursday.

394.title: Over 13 lakh Income Tax Returns filed after July 31: Data
394.article_body: The latest data on the Income Tax website showed that over 13 lakh Income Tax Returns (ITRs) were filed after July 31, which was the deadline to file ITRs by salaried individuals. Till July 31, over 5.83 crore ITRs were filed, while the number increased to 5.96 crore as on August 15. Taxpayers have to pay penalties for late filing.

395.title: 16-yr-old commits 6 robberies in less than 24 hrs in Delhi, apprehended
395.article_body: A 16-year-old boy allegedly committed six robberies in less than 24 hours in South Delhi's Hauz Khas, Saket and other areas on Independence Day, police said. The minor, allegedly a drug addict involved in over 13 cases of robberies, theft and snatching, was apprehended on Wednesday, police added. "All the complainants...saw the accused leave on a blue scooter," police stated.

396.title: Why does the media always tell lies?: Shehnaaz Gill on rumours of dating Raghav Juyal
396.article_body: Addressing the rumours that she is dating her 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' co-star Raghav Juyal, Shehnaaz Gill said, "Media jhoot kyun bolti hai? Media har bar jhoot bolti hai (Why does the media always tell lies?)." She added, "Just because we're standing next to someone, or hanging out, doesn't mean we are dating...I will get hyper now."

397.title: Goa MLA writes to PM Modi, demands dismissal of Irani over 'illegal' bar
397.article_body: Goa Congress MLA Sankalp Amonkar wrote to PM Narendra Modi demanding immediate sacking of Union Minister Smriti Irani to pave way for a free and fair investigation into her alleged 'illegal' bar business in Goa. "All circumstantial evidence...documents of Registrar of companies Maharashtra and GST details prove prima facie that the restaurant in question...is run by her family," said Amonkar.

398.title: India's Russian oil buying falls in July, Saudi imports rise: Report
398.article_body: For the first time since March, India's crude oil imports from Russia fell in July, while supplies from Saudi Arabia rebounded, trade and industry sources said. India imported 8,77,400 barrels per day (bpd) of oil from Russia in July, which is nearly 7.3% lesser than in June. India imported 25.6% more oil from Saudi Arabia at 8,24,700 bpd in July.

399.title: They wanted me to remake '3 Idiots' in Tamil, didn't do that: Madhavan
399.article_body: R Madhavan, during an interview, was asked about his decision of directing remakes of his own films. To this, he replied, "They wanted me to remake '3 Idiots' in Tamil but I didn't do that. I realised that it would become difficult for me." The 2009 film also featured Aamir Khan, Boman Irani and Kareena Kapoor Khan.

400.title: Do people not trust CM Mamata?: BJP leader on 'New TMC' posters in Kolkata
400.article_body: Following posters claiming "new and reformed TMC will come into being in six months" were put up in Kolkata, BJP’s Samik Bhattacharya asked, "Does it mean...people no more trust [CM] Mamata Banerjee…TMC needs a new face?" The posters had photographs of TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee. Bhattacharya added, "People are against TMC’s loot. The party’s days are numbered."
